name: Mark C. Wilson
content: Mark C. Wilson I was born in New Zealand and pursued an academic career. I received BSc(Hons) from University of Canterbury and PhD from University of Wisconsin-Madison, both in mathematics. I was a Lecturer/Senior Lecturer (= Assistant Professor/tenured Associate Professor) at University of Auckland School of Computer Science 2001-2019. In 2019-2025 I held visiting positions at the University of Massachusetts Amherst and Smith College. Some key links related to my academic career: PhD genealogy | Erdos number | academic CV | Google Scholar profile | editorial work To contact me by email, please use the contact form. Latest news is here. I am looking for a new challenge outside academia in the general area of data science. Here are a 1-page resume and a 2-page resume. Other links: Github | Youtube channel When I was much younger, I was a junior chess champion and quiz champion. The 1988 NZ University Challenge final is available to those in NZ. I play some chess online at chess.com. I have also played competitive Scrabble in the past. Other activities that I have some skill at include singing, badminton and downhill skiing.
